<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/19/50-states-begun-reopening?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Quarantine Man Buns May Not Last the Week
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Haircut" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMDEzL2hhaXJjdXQuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Diego Puletto/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As of today, all 50 states have begun <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/05/19/health/us-coronavirus-tuesday/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">loosening</a> business restrictions implemented to fight the pandemic. But with varying or unclear federal, state, and county rules, reopening has more moving parts than a middle school love triangle. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">This week in reopenings...</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the Northeast, Massachusetts <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/05/18/us/massachusetts-connecticut-reopening-coronavirus/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">began</a> easing restrictions on manufacturing, construction, and places of worship. NY Gov. Andrew Cuomo said Albany is <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-05-19/cuomo-lets-albany-reopen-cites-great-progress-on-long-island?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ready</a> and Long Island could be close. And a Memorial Day miracle: Delaware and the NYC tri-state area will open beaches for the unofficial start to summer. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In Florida, retail and entertainment center Disney Springs will begin a <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/travel/2020/05/18/disney-takes-steps-toward-us-reopening-not-everyone-finds-new-conditions-magical/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">partial reopening</a> today. The state began its Phase 1 reopening this week with restaurants, malls, and gyms at half capacity. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">California relaxed requirements for counties to enter Phase 2 and, along with New York and Texas, said it’s ready for <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/05/18/politics/professional-sports-coronavirus-california-new-york-texas/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pro sports to return</a> in a couple weeks. No fans in the stands, but with <em>The</em> <em>Last Dance</em> over we’ll take it. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Even when businesses reopen, nervous customers aren’t always returning in full force. Some officials have emphasized a full-scale reopening <a href="https://www.foxnews.com/politics/hunker-down-some-states-say-no-full-scale-reopening-until-coronavirus-vaccine-is-ready?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">can’t happen</a> without proven vaccines or treatments. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What they’re worried about</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With reopenings underway, at least 17 states have logged a 10% or more uptick in average daily new cases. Texas is reopening child care centers, bars, and bingo centers this week, yet reported its largest daily increase last weekend. North Carolina did the same, and Arizona approached a record high.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">However, that’s partially the result of increased testing. And some states have seen no changes (Florida) or even decreases (Georgia). </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The unemployment question </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Over 36 million workers have filed for unemployment in the last two months, and as businesses reopen, some will get offers to return. But many employers aren’t clear about the rules for providing a safe workplace, especially when plexiglass dividers and Clorox wipes don't come cheap.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The Brew explains: </strong>What happens when workers are unable to return or don’t feel safe doing so? Go deeper with our guide to <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/19/state-reopenings-spark-unemployment-migraine?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reopening and unemployment</a>.</p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/19/walmart-reports-soaring-ecomm-sales?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Pandemic Bobs, Walmart Weaves
</font></a>
</h1>

<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Walmart website loading slowly" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/41/walmart_slow_e-commerce">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Walmart <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/walmart-q1-earnings-covid-19-111010251.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reported earnings</a> for the quarter that ended April 30 (when you’re No. 1 on the Fortune 500, you get to make your own rules). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You also get a leg up when disaster hits. U.S. comparable sales were up 10% for the quarter, and e-commerce sales skyrocketed 74% thanks to Walmart’s forays into home delivery and grocery pickup. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The number of new customers trying online pickup and delivery grew 4x since mid-March. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For other retailers, those same three months were….what’s a nicer word than “bloodbath”? But Walmart’s massive scale positioned it to catch the coronavirus curveball in customer behavior. “It is a big advantage being an omnichannel retailer and I think that is showing right now,” CFO Brett Biggs humblebragged. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ They almost snuck it past us. </strong>Walmart <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2020/05/19/walmart-says-it-will-discontinue-jet-com-which-it-acquired-for-3b-in-2016/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">also mumbled</a> that it’s shuttering Jet.com, an online marketplace Walmart bought in 2016 in an effort to make Jeff Bezos sweat. But after a series of reshuffles, Walmart decided Jet.com wasn't the e-commerce silver bullet it once thought.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/19/joe-rogan-show-becomes-exclusive-spotify?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Green Ball With Three Bendy Lines Experience
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="Joe Rogan" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMDEyL2pvZV9yb2dhbi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Michael S. Schwartz/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Joe Rogan said he's taking his smash-hit podcast (~190 million downloads/month) <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/spotify-strikes-exclusive-podcast-deal-with-joe-rogan-11589913814?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">exclusively to Spotify</a> in a licensing deal worth more than $100 million, the WSJ reports. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What that means:</strong> Starting September 1, full audio and video of <em>The </em><em>Joe Rogan Experience </em>will be available on Spotify—and it'll be pulled from all other platforms before the end of the year. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Yes, we said video. Spotify started testing video pods earlier this month; with Rogan it'll get a YouTube star. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Up until now, Rogan’s show has never been available on Spotify.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What that </strong><strong style="color:#000"><em>really</em></strong><strong style="color:#000"> means: </strong>Spotify is quadrupling down on podcasting. Over the past two years, Spotify bolstered its podcast chops with acquisitions of The Ringer and Gimlet Media, and it's recently inked deals with marquee names like Amy Schumer. By nabbing Rogan, Spotify isn’t just continuing its wrestling match with pod incumbent Apple, it’s breaching YouTube’s turf. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The move is well-timed. </strong>According to eMarketer, consumers <a href="https://www.axios.com/music-podcasts-coronavirus-lockdown-c8856df1-e21c-41b9-8298-8c6bada923ed.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">are shifting</a> their gaze to video over audio in the quarantine era. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What <strong style="color:#000">pair</strong> does she most <strong style="color:#000">care </strong>for? Our CARIUMA <strong style="color:#000">IBIs</strong>. But <strong style="color:#000">why?</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://cariuma.com/pages/mb-may20?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=sponsored+email&utm_campaign=weekly_A&utm_content=x20May20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CARIUMA IBI sneakers</a></span><span> are </span><span><strong style="color:#000">old-school cool</strong></span><span>. It’s no </span><span><strong style="color:#000">doubt</strong></span><span> why they keep selling </span><span><strong style="color:#000">out</strong></span><span>.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Their IBIs are made with </span><span><strong style="color:#000">perfect-fit</strong></span><span> </span><span><strong style="color:#000">bamboo-knit</strong></span><span> fabrication and sugarcane outsoles.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It’s harder to write a rhyming ad than we thought.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We also love our <a href="https://cariuma.com/pages/mb-may20?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=sponsored+email&utm_campaign=weekly_A&utm_content=x20May20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CARIUMAs</a>. Cuz their IBIs are <a href="https://cariuma.com/pages/mb-may20?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=sponsored+email&utm_campaign=weekly_A&utm_content=x20May20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">comfy</a>. Cuz of their myriad dope <a href="https://cariuma.com/pages/mb-may20?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=sponsored+email&utm_campaign=weekly_A&utm_content=x20May20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">colors</a>. Cuz our friends give us <a href="https://cariuma.com/pages/mb-may20?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=sponsored+email&utm_campaign=weekly_A&utm_content=x20May20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">compliments</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Wait, this was supposed to be a rhyming ad, so we guess we <em>should</em> say: Our <strong style="color:#000">IBIs</strong> make our feet look <strong style="color:#000">fly</strong>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And since we’re still doing the rhyming thing, know that <a href="https://cariuma.com/pages/mb-may20?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=sponsored+email&utm_campaign=weekly_A&utm_content=x20May20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CARIUMA</a> uses recycled <strong style="color:#000">plastics</strong> which is just <strong style="color:#000">fantastic</strong>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">These 100% vegan, <a href="https://cariuma.com/pages/mb-may20?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=sponsored+email&utm_campaign=weekly_A&utm_content=x20May20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">carbon-neutral</a> shoes have sold out three times and had a 12k person waitlist. But now they're back in stock and Brew readers get first dibs.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s some <strong style="color:#000">news</strong> you can really <strong style="color:#000">use</strong>.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/19/senate-committee-questions-powell-mnuchin-relief-packages?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Powell, Mnuchin Circle Back With Senators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Treasury Sec. Steve Mnuchin and Fed Chair Jerome Powell underwent a <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/05/19/politics/powell-mnuchin-cares-stimulus-spending/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">joint performance review</a>. The Senate Banking Committee questioned the pair via videoconference on how the $2.2 trillion relief package, aka the CARES Act, played out in its first public update. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Some highlights: </strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>There’s a Lincoln Tunnel-sized stretch before the light. Powell and Mnuchin both signaled more severe job losses ahead before the economy begins to claw back. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>About $550 million of the small business loans that went to public companies has been returned, meaning a majority of publicly traded companies that received funds kept them. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Sen. Elizabeth Warren called for...can you guess? CEOs to be held “personally accountable” if their companies illegitimately access CARES Act funds. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Powell said the focus should be on local economies, and that the Fed might even buy municipal debt. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Mnuchin was more concerned that prolonged shutdowns could cause “permanent damage” to the economy. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the review was also a brainstorming session. Congress is working on a fourth economic relief package.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CLIMATE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/19/daily-co2-emissions-plunge-global-lockdowns?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Carbon Dioxide Also Spent the Last Few Months in Quarantine
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Daily global CO<sub style="display: inline-block; line-height: 16px;">2</sub> emissions fell 17% by early April over last year’s average, according to a <a href="https://www.nature.com/articles/s41558-020-0797-x?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new study</a> published in the journal <em>Nature Climate Change</em>. Such a drop could be the largest on record, the authors conclude. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">By the end of 2020, the study predicts total emissions could drop between 4% and 7%, depending on the path of recovery.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What happened: </strong>Nothing. Nothing happened. Major sources of carbon emissions—cars, planes, factories—all <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/science/environment/carbon-emissions-dropped-17-percent-globally-amid-coronavirus-n1210331?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stood still</a> as governments implemented lockdowns to reduce the spread of COVID-19. Drilling a little deeper…</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Surface transportation including cars, buses, and trucks accounted for 43% of the total decrease.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Emissions in the aviation sector declined 60%, and industrial production 19%.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">So...about climate change…</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://media.giphy.com/media/H4zC1A2FZ0ViA6GcxD/giphy.gif" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="" data-reactroot=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><small> <em>Giphy</em> </small></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Well, no. This major dip in emissions is what your stats professor might call an “outlier,” and not representative of long-term trends. After all, shutting down your economy because of a global pandemic is “not the way to tackle climate change,” explains the study’s lead author.</p>

collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs of today, all 50 states have begun \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/05/19/health/us-coronavirus-tuesday/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eloosening\u003c/a\u003e business restrictions implemented to fight the pandemic. But with varying or unclear federal, state, and county rules, reopening has more moving parts than a middle school love triangle. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThis week in reopenings...\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn the Northeast, Massachusetts \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/05/18/us/massachusetts-connecticut-reopening-coronavirus/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebegan\u003c/a\u003e easing restrictions on manufacturing, construction, and places of worship. NY Gov. Andrew Cuomo said Albany is \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-05-19/cuomo-lets-albany-reopen-cites-great-progress-on-long-island?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eready\u003c/a\u003e and Long Island could be close. And a Memorial Day miracle: Delaware and the NYC tri-state area will open beaches for the unofficial start to summer. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn Florida, retail and entertainment center Disney Springs will begin a \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/travel/2020/05/18/disney-takes-steps-toward-us-reopening-not-everyone-finds-new-conditions-magical/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epartial reopening\u003c/a\u003e today. The state began its Phase 1 reopening this week with restaurants, malls, and gyms at half capacity. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCalifornia relaxed requirements for counties to enter Phase 2 and, along with New York and Texas, said it’s ready for \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/05/18/politics/professional-sports-coronavirus-california-new-york-texas/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epro sports to return\u003c/a\u003e in a couple weeks. No fans in the stands, but with \u003cem\u003eThe\u003c/em\u003e \u003cem\u003eLast Dance\u003c/em\u003e over we’ll take it. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eEven when businesses reopen, nervous customers aren’t always returning in full force. Some officials have emphasized a full-scale reopening \u003ca href=\"https://www.foxnews.com/politics/hunker-down-some-states-say-no-full-scale-reopening-until-coronavirus-vaccine-is-ready?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecan’t happen\u003c/a\u003e without proven vaccines or treatments. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat they’re worried about\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith reopenings underway, at least 17 states have logged a 10% or more uptick in average daily new cases. Texas is reopening child care centers, bars, and bingo centers this week, yet reported its largest daily increase last weekend. North Carolina did the same, and Arizona approached a record high.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHowever, that’s partially the result of increased testing. And some states have seen no changes (Florida) or even decreases (Georgia). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe unemployment question \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOver 36 million workers have filed for unemployment in the last two months, and as businesses reopen, some will get offers to return. But many employers aren’t clear about the rules for providing a safe workplace, especially when plexiglass dividers and Clorox wipes don't come cheap.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe Brew explains: \u003c/strong\u003eWhat happens when workers are unable to return or don’t feel safe doing so? collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Walmart \u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/walmart-q1-earnings-covid-19-111010251.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereported earnings\u003c/a\u003e for the quarter that ended April 30 (when you’re No. 1 on the Fortune 500, you get to make your own rules). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYou also get a leg up when disaster hits. U.S. comparable sales were up 10% for the quarter, and e-commerce sales skyrocketed 74% thanks to Walmart’s forays into home delivery and grocery pickup. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe number of new customers trying online pickup and delivery grew 4x since mid-March. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor other retailers, those same three months were….what’s a nicer word than “bloodbath”? But Walmart’s massive scale positioned it to catch the coronavirus curveball in customer behavior. “It is a big advantage being an omnichannel retailer and I think that is showing right now,” CFO Brett Biggs humblebragged. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ They almost snuck it past us. \u003c/strong\u003eWalmart \u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2020/05/19/walmart-says-it-will-discontinue-jet-com-which-it-acquired-for-3b-in-2016/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ealso mumbled\u003c/a\u003e that it’s shuttering Jet.com, an online marketplace Walmart bought in 2016 in an effort to make Jeff Bezos sweat. But after a series of reshuffles, Walmart decided Jet.com wasn't the e-commerce silver bullet it once thought.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eMichael S. Schwartz/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Joe Rogan said he's taking his smash-hit podcast (~190 million downloads/month) \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/spotify-strikes-exclusive-podcast-deal-with-joe-rogan-11589913814?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexclusively to Spotify\u003c/a\u003e in a licensing deal worth more than $100 million, the WSJ reports. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat that means:\u003c/strong\u003e Starting September 1, full audio and video of \u003cem\u003eThe \u003c/em\u003e\u003cem\u003eJoe Rogan Experience \u003c/em\u003ewill be available on Spotify—and it'll be pulled from all other platforms before the end of the year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eYes, we said video. Spotify started testing video pods earlier this month; with Rogan it'll get a YouTube star. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eUp until now, Rogan’s show has never been available on Spotify.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat that \u003c/strong\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003cem\u003ereally\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e means: \u003c/strong\u003eSpotify is quadrupling down on podcasting. Over the past two years, Spotify bolstered its podcast chops with acquisitions of The Ringer and Gimlet Media, and it's recently inked deals with marquee names like Amy Schumer. By nabbing Rogan, Spotify isn’t just continuing its wrestling match with pod incumbent Apple, it’s breaching YouTube’s turf. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe move is well-timed. \u003c/strong\u003eAccording to eMarketer, consumers \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/music-podcasts-coronavirus-lockdown-c8856df1-e21c-41b9-8298-8c6bada923ed.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eare shifting\u003c/a\u003e their gaze to video over audio in the quarantine era. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS Steve Mnuchin and Fed Chair Jerome Powell underwent a \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/05/19/politics/powell-mnuchin-cares-stimulus-spending/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ejoint performance review\u003c/a\u003e. The Senate Banking Committee questioned the pair via videoconference on how the $2.2 trillion relief package, aka the CARES Act, played out in its first public update. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSome highlights: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThere’s a Lincoln Tunnel-sized stretch before the light. Powell and Mnuchin both signaled more severe job losses ahead before the economy begins to claw back. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAbout $550 million of the small business loans that went to public companies has been returned, meaning a majority of publicly traded companies that received funds kept them. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSen. Elizabeth Warren called for...can you guess? CEOs to be held “personally accountable” if their companies illegitimately access CARES Act funds. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePowell said the focus should be on local economies, and that the Fed might even buy municipal debt. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMnuchin was more concerned that prolonged shutdowns could cause “permanent damage” to the economy. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe review was also a brainstorming session. style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDaily global CO\u003csub style=\"display: inline-block; line-height: 16px;\"\u003e2\u003c/sub\u003e emissions fell 17% by early April over last year’s average, according to a \u003ca href=\"https://www.nature.com/articles/s41558-020-0797-x?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enew study\u003c/a\u003e published in the journal \u003cem\u003eNature Climate Change\u003c/em\u003e. Such a drop could be the largest on record, the authors conclude. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBy the end of 2020, the study predicts total emissions could drop between 4% and 7%, depending on the path of recovery.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat happened: \u003c/strong\u003eNothing. Nothing happened. Major sources of carbon emissions—cars, planes, factories—all \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/science/environment/carbon-emissions-dropped-17-percent-globally-amid-coronavirus-n1210331?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estood still\u003c/a\u003e as governments implemented lockdowns to reduce the spread of COVID-19. Drilling a little deeper…\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSurface transportation including cars, buses, and trucks accounted for 43% of the total decrease.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eEmissions in the aviation sector declined 60%, and industrial production 19%.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSo...about climate change…\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/H4zC1A2FZ0ViA6GcxD/giphy.gif\" class=\"img-responsive\" width=\"640\" style=\"width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;\" alt=\"\" data-reactroot=\"\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e \u003cem\u003eGiphy\u003c/em\u003e \u003c/small\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWell, no. This major dip in emissions is what your stats professor might call an “outlier,” and not representative of long-term trends.
